body:
@alespergl I do not see that. Just installed a fresh Ubuntu 16.04 LTS running via Parallels on macOS:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/37421716-52d66f96-27ba-11e8-9143-6bcaf549d9b1.png)

Interesting! I'm not seeing this in 17.10. I'll see if I can reproduce the behavior in 16.04 LTS.

![menu-ubuntu-17 10-radiance-theme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70381/37429929-148e4790-2814-11e8-9c6f-6add5bba22fa.png)

Huzzah, it's repeatable:

I'm seeing this behavior when running in the Adwaita-dark theme. Inspiration by @bjornharrtell's comment at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/45542#issuecomment-373152885

LibreOffice had the same issue.
https://bugs.documentfoundation.org/show_bug.cgi?id=101471

They seem to have patched it with
https://cgit.freedesktop.org/libreoffice/core/commit/?id=72eb18e520ea8165a6a20958a1551f55e5e14cab

issue.title: Better GTK+ Menu color support

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
* Fix 'invisible menu' issue (#12275)

 * Now updates menu text color when focus changes

 * Better caching of colors when system theme changes

 * Removed all GTK+ deprecation warnings from menubar

body: It seems like the fix has been merged to the `2-0-x` branch.

![screenshot from 2018-11-19 16-48-59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4988234/48704275-1fb51280-ec1c-11e8-88eb-3da0dbdb4d07.png)

Electron Version - 4.0.0-beta.6
Operating system: Ubuntu 18.10

Guys, I am still facing the issue.
Any update on this?

issue.title: In Ubuntu, the main menu text is unreadable.
issue.body:
In Ubuntu 18.10, with the default "Yaru" theme, the menu background is dark. Because the text is also dark, the menu is not readable. With a light theme, the menu is readable.  The screenshot shows how things look with a dark and a light theme:

![menu not readable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11945339/48434884-4c2fe100-e77b-11e8-9b5d-6ff816dcf6e5.png)

body: According to Trish at Slack QA, this is still reproducible in both Electron 3 & 4.

Thank you for taking the time to report this issue and helping to make Electron better.

The version of Electron you reported this on has been superseded by newer releases. 

If you're still experiencing this issue in Electron 6.x.y or later, please add a comment specifying the version you're testing with and any other new information that a maintainer trying to reproduce the issue should know.

I'm setting the `blocked/need-info` label for the above reasons. This issue will be closed 7 days from now if there is no response.

Thanks in advance! Your help is appreciated.

Still observable on Ubuntu 16.04 running electron version 
electron --version = v8.0.1
run electron or any electron based application. No menus are shown.
I am new to Electron, but I can try to debug this on my system if someone has some suggestions on where to look initially.
